properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9

verse.name: v1
v2
v3
verse.lines: Come, for creation groans, Impatient of Thy stay, Worn out with these long years of ill, These ages of delay.

verse.name: v4
v5
verse.lines: Come, for the truth is weak, And error pours abroad Its subtle poison o’er the earth— An earth that hates her God.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Come, for love waxes cold, Its steps are faint and slow; Faith now is lost in unbelief, Hope’s lamp burns dim and low.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Come, for the corn is ripe, Put in thy sickle now, Reap the great harvest of the earth— Sower and reaper Thou.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Come, and make all things new, Build up this ruined earth; Restore our faded paradise, Creation’s second birth.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: Come, and begin Thy reign Of everlasting peace; Come, take the kingdom to Thyself, Great King of righteousness.
